ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learnt about renowned Arabic writer naguib mahfouz

This class helped me develop much stronger Arabic writing and reading skills. While we definitely worked on speaking, I think that the literary aspect of this course ensured that much of my improvement was in the areas of reading and writing. Prior courses in Arabic do, of course, give us a chance to read, but this course really forced me to improve how I read.

Any practice of MSA is good to improve my MSA, even if the class may not have been facilitated in the best possible manner. I would recommend taking whatever Arabic class you can if you intend to work on your Arabic.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: interesting books and discussion 

Weaknesses: books are long so we dont get to read that many over the course of the class

The class is well set up to facilitate student learning. I think that, as with any course, particularly a foreign language, there were some technical issues, but no one is at fault for those. Professor Aziz did a great job of putting us into breakout rooms for pair discussions and facilitating conversations about the works we read.

I dont think this was the best on Zoom. Professor Aziz is a lovely human being who is quite old and who did in fact figure out how to do breakout rooms as well as show us videos based on the reading. Nevertheless, the class was not terribly interesting and not facilitated well given the Zoom format.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I loved the added component of watching the series
I think the use of breakout rooms and discussion questions really helped us make the most of our class time and gave direction to our discussion, which would have otherwise been difficult over Zoom.
Any Arabic class at Yale will help you learn . So yeah, I would, in the sense of you should. Would I say take this class over another, more scintillating one? Maybe, maybe not?

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes I would definitely recommend! A safe learning environment with interesting discussion and content
This course is an excellent way to improve one's Arabic skills.
Any Arabic class at Yale will help you learn . So yeah, I would, in the sense of you should. Would I say take this class over another, more scintillating one? Maybe, maybe not?
